thread.title: South West MEP quits 'homophobic and anti-Islamic' UKIP - Devon Live

author: Max Channon
title: South West MEP quits 'homophobic and anti-Islamic' UKIP - Devon Live
text:
Ukip's former international trade spokesman William Dartmouth MEP speaking at the party's spring conference in Bolton. Get Daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
One of UKIP's most respected and senior politicians has quit the party - claiming it has become "widely perceived as both homophobic and anti-Islamic".
South West MEP Lord William Dartmouth, William Legge the 10th Earl of Dartmouth, said UKIP's leader Gerard Batten has moved the party "further and further to the Right".
Lord Dartmouth, who left the Conservative Party to join UKIP in 2007, accused Batten of "hijacking" the party to "campaign against Islam as a religion" and associating himself with "outlandish people and extreme right-wing groups".
"The work of all those who worked so hard in their support of Brexit is being devalued," he added. Read More Urgent warning over Cornwall primary school children playing suicide dating app game Doki Doki
The Earl, who is also is an hereditary peer in the House of Lords, left the Tories after citing concerns about the policies of David Cameron, who as then Leader of the Opposition.
However, he quit UKIP's front bench earlier this year after leader Henry Bolton refused to resign - and has now left the party completely.
His fellow South West MEP, Molly Scott Cato of the Green party, said that - for once - she agrees with the Earl.
“I think it’s safe to say that I have nothing in common politically with Lord Dartmouth but finally I can find something where we agree," said Molly Scott Cato. Read More Third monkeypox case confirmed after first diagnosis in Cornwall
"His resignation confirms what many have long believed, that UKIP is a racist and Islamophobic Party.
"As such it poses real dangers to community cohesion. It is time all self-respecting citizens and politicians took a stand against this hatred and challenged the generous platform given to UKIP to spout its vile views.” Want more news?
